column1: From Leadville to Aspen  A Hold Up in the Rockies   is a 1906 American short action crime western film  directed by an uncredited  Francis J  Marion  and  Wallace McCutcheon  of the  American Mutoscope  amp  Biograph Company  of New York City    1       The film features a train traveling through the Rockies and a hold up created by two thugs placing logs on the line  They systematically rob the wealthy occupants at gunpoint and then make their getaway along the tracks and later by a hi jacked horse and cart
